reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed for a week for our 10th anniversary. I was there the same time as the previous reviewer. While the mosquitos were bad, the hotel was going around spraying 2x/day. Other people we met at other hotels also were having issues with the mosquitos. They are bad all over!!! Put some bug spray on and get over it!!! They never got into our room unless we left a door open. But the rest of the place was incredible. It felt like paradise!!! The rooms were great. The entertainment great and the staff was very friendly. The beach was gorgeous and we never had any issues finding a cabana to relax under all day. Bring your own insulated cups, they will make your drinks right in there for you. Tipping helped with some of the service but it wasnt required. My only complaint would be while the food tasted excellent, it was the same food every day. Lunch and dinner was the same. So it is best to go to the ala carte restaurants. Stick with the Romantique and Italian. But the alcohol was great and they werent conservative with the rum. Overall this was the best vacation I ever had and I cant wait to bring my kids back next year!!!
reviews.title: Cant wait to go back next year!!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Had a 10 night break at the Paradisus aradero in June 2008 and we loved it. The hotel has such a pretty setting, the main entrance, foyet, bar and grounds are lovely. The rooms are a great size - they are not the grandest rooms, and yes the beds are harder than what we are used to at home, but that is Cuba. The maids are lovely and will go out of their way to help you if you need anything - and they keep the rooms so clean with lovely flowers dotted about some days. The gardeners are also so friendly and often get forgotton about with tips etc. We found that you didn't need to tip often, or much money - but they appreciated colouring pencils, pens etc for their children, any toiletries you have left, any old t shirts or clothes you are leaving behind etc. Baseball hats also went down well with the gardeners and pool men. We found that if you give a small monetary tip at the start of your stay to the pool man etc - they will look after you for the whole stay without looking for more tips.
reviews.title: Paradisus Paradise

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The a la carte restaurants are fantastic - we managed to get at least 2 bookings per restaurant as we were there in a quieter season. The Japanese and the Romantica are by far the best.
reviews.title: One of the best in Varadero
great beach
reviews.text: The night time entertainment is ok - not the best - but some of it is worth sitting through. There is also an air conditioned bar called the fun pub - although it is not really a busy, "fun" bar - it is worth it for the air con - nice place to go to cool down in the evenings.
The pool is huge (keep an eye out for the bright blue and green lizards on the central island trees in the pool - they are fantastic).
reviews.title: Overall Great, but Needs some Balanced Insight of Hotel Management Level

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My boyfriend and I satayed at the Paradisus December 7-14 2008 and I cannot say enough great things about this hotel! Between my boyfriend and I we have visited 7 all inclusive resorts so we have a pretty good basis for comparison.
reviews.title: Amazing Resort

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Check-In: Our flight was very delayed so we ended up checking in at 6:30 am instead of 8pm. The check in staff was great, got us set up in a matter of minutes. One thing that was strange was we were only given one key as was everyone. Im not sure if you could request another one, we didnt bother. As with most hotels in Cuba, they keep your passport overnight, not to worry just go to the front desk the next morning and they will give it back. Once we were checked in our bags were loaded into a golf cart and we were given a ride to our room. The bellman carried all of our bags up to our room for us which was great since we were exhausted!
reviews.title: Lovely hotel not much to do in the evening though!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Rooms: The rooms are beautiful, we requested and received a king sized bed. There are min'fridges in the rooms along with a lounger and a little living room with some chairs and a coffee table. The tub and tiolet are in a room seperate from the sink and mirror which was great because one of us could shower while the other was getting ready. The lights at this hotel are klind of funny, you have to stick your room key into a slot on the wall to make the lights come on. They will stay on for about 5minutes after you remove your key. This is to save power, the only time it was really an issue was when i wanted to go back to the room and my bf wanted to stay out and drink. We did figure out on the last night that it didnt have to be your room key that went into the slot, and card that is the same size will work. I had a room key from another hotel and used it...too bad we didnt figure that out earlier!
reviews.title: Disgusted with the hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Food: The a la cartes were incredible. I highly recomend the Italian so yummy! You get to go to each of the a la cartes (4) once per week that you are there. The buffet was alright, keep in mind that you are in a communist third world type country that is almost entirley cut off from foreign trade. The do the best with what they have. The food is not great anywhere in Cuba but almost anyone can find something. The bread is really good and so is the past. I did find that the buffet food was often cold but I ate mostly the fresh grilled meat at the end and the pasta bar (they put your noodle and sauce in a pan and heat it for you). One tip if you order the omlettes make sure to ask for well done, otherwise it wont be cooked all the way, I find this common with every all inclusive I have been to.
reviews.title: Disappointing

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Bars: The lobby bar has really great capuccino in the mornings and they also have Baileys that they will add if you want. Lobby bar is open 24 hours and at night they have a band or piano player. A few nights there was even a sax player walking around playing. This charming world is privileged with elegance, refinement and privacy, especially its Royal Service. Recommended for families, weddings, honeymoons, incentives and wellness/spa.
